comment.text: Fixes a GPU process crash on start-up.

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:

Chromium's GPU process fails to start. Firefox and other Electron apps don't seem to complain.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
chromium-112.0.5615.49-1.fc38.x86_64

How reproducible:
Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start Chromium from a terminal
2. Watch the window flickering a couple of times
3. Read the logs

Actual results:
[5590:5590:0415/162728.470009:FATAL:gpu_init.cc(542)] Passthrough is not supported, GL is egl, ANGLE is 
[5500:5500:0415/162728.770166:ERROR:gpu_process_host.cc(942)] GPU process exited unexpectedly: exit_code=133

Expected results:
No flicker, no errors.

Additional info:
Noticed while investigating https://bugzilla.rpmfusion.org/show_bug.cgi?id=6635, but this one happens without the rpmfusion VA-API drivers.
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-fc1538262d has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 9. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-fc1538262d
FEDORA-2023-df075a7f85 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 38. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-df075a7f85
FEDORA-2023-c1741c9724 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 36. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-c1741c9724
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-c126e4af73 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-c126e4af73
FEDORA-2023-8cc9731416 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 37. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-8cc9731416
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-9631f50abc has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 8. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-9631f50abc

Two remarks:

1. the original issue still happens if I configure Chromium to use Wayland (I checked with lg in GNOME)
2. with chromium-112.0.5615.121-2.fc38, I still see "gpu_init.cc(525)] Passthrough is not supported, GL is egl, ANGLE is", but not the GPU process crash. I can confirm that Google Maps renders fast, but I didn't check anything else.
Okay, that message seems to be related to ANGLE: https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=976283. I guess it's fine, then.

bugzilla.short_desc: Lost ability to apply visual effects

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
After the following upgrade

Package chromium.x86_64 111.0.5563.146-1.el9 will be upgraded
Package chromium.x86_64 112.0.5615.49-1.el9 will be an upgrade

I lost the ability to apply visual effects, for instance a background image.

The error message is:

Configure your browser for visual effects

To use visual effects, turn on hardware acceleration in your browser settings

However, HW acceleration is already enabled. Deleting the chromium cache/config directories and starting with all-defaults, HW acceleration is enabled in Settings but still applying visual effects fail.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
chromium-112.0.5615.49-1.el9.x86_64

it should be fixed in chromium-112.0.5615.121-2.el9. Could you please down the new version from
 https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=100072566

and give a try?

Thanks!

bugs.title: Hardware acceleration for chromium is not available, even when forcing it

bugzilla.short_desc: Hardware acceleration for chromium is not available, even when forcing it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/112.0
Build Identifier: 

When launching the chromium web browser, hardware acceleration does not work, which degrades the performance of the browser a lot.

The chromium flatpak and the fedora firefox package work with hardware acceleration just fine.

I use an AMD RX Vega 56 graphics card with the mesa drivers.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Open the chromium web browser
2.Type chrome://gpu in the url bar and press enter
Actual Results:  
Hardware acceleration does not work at all.

Expected Results:  
Hardware acceleration should work.

Here is the output of chrtome://gpu

Vulkan: Disabled

Expose EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture
